originalText.text: What is wrong with this office manager or assistant office manager? Not sure what her title is but she is African American. I have seen her twice being absolutely horrible to patients. Honestly, the last thing Mount Sinai needs is someone this unprofessional in a customer service position. She does not know how to speak to people. Jeez.

originalText.text: Two stars for well-lit, clean reception area and front staff staying somewhat courteous.  This is a BUSINESS catering mostly to upper middle class and it shows, in not so endearing ways.

text.text: Two stars for well-lit, clean reception area and front staff staying somewhat courteous.  This is a BUSINESS catering mostly to upper middle class and it shows, in not so endearing ways.

originalText.text: Facility was clean brightly lit front desk was courteous wait time to see Dr Richard Mizuguchi was minimal, his longtime nurse assistant escorted me tom a room. Dr Mizuguchi entered room he is a very small person friendly and talkative! If you are expecting the normative first examination or basic questions regarding why you requested a Dermatologist appointment you will be disappointed! My appointment with Dr Mizuguchi consisted of pleasant innocuous conversation about a wide array of topics astonishingly none of which were even remotely related to skincare! Dr Richard Mizuguchi practice did not include injectables nor anything suggestive of maintaining healthy skincare habits! I did have a question about some skin anomalies I was concerned about he responded by briefly using his hand held magnifying glass he dismissed my concern to sun damage! He stood up bid me goodbye thus ending one of the strangest Dermatological appointments I‚Äôd ever had! Dr Richard Mizuguchi is one of the most incompetent Dermatologist I‚Äôd ever met,a total waste of time and money payment requested before you meet the doctor my suggestion skip this Dermatologist

originalText.text:
Callous, unprofessional, unethical, few ways to describe this practice. They lost my physical medical forms. Their assistant manager (African American) should not be in a client facing role. A simple apology should have been sufficient. Instead, she got hostile and refused to acknowledge the error. After I threatened to report this, I got numerous calls from their clinic, apologizing for losing my medical forms.

I have heard one of their doctors talk disparagingly about patients suffering from chronic illness. She said, ‚Äúwhat these people need is therapy, not medical care.‚Äù She was specially critical of a male patient of hers who suffers from fibromyalgia. She said she never takes him seriously. üò≥

I have heard one of the front desk girl openly talk about patient‚Äôs medical conditions in the lobby in-front of everyone. I heard the same person make up random policies that does not exist on their site or at practice to a patient. It was so whack that I had to look it up.  Although, it is part of a billion dollar enterprise, this clinic is run like a mom and pop shop. Honestly, felt like the Wild Wild West.

originalText.text: I never thought I could go there but I had no choice but with a special type of boot and a Walker with my sister's help thank God I was able to get there I had to meet my new PCP for medical treatment cause I needed one for medical treatment options and medical counseling with treatment goals to better myself yeah all of us with ailments need help I got mine I didn't know that the bus on ave.c goes down 20th I thought I had to transfer to the m23 well maybe since it goes on ave. C a new route was put there well its down town route is the same well my map reading skills are say top notch
